alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 26 at 4:54PM MST until June 26 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Navajo County in north central Arizona... Apache County in northeastern Arizona... * Until 800 PM MST. * At 449 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area, along and 30 miles north of Interstate 40 in Navajo and Apache counties. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in some areas. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sun Valley, Petrified Forest National Park, Castle Butte, Dilkon, Chambers, Sanders. This includes the following highways... State Route 77 between mile markers 396 and 408. Highway 191 between mile markers 374 and 383. Highway 191 161 near mile marker 368. State Route 87 between mile markers 361 and 376. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Cottonwood Wash, Dead Wash, Puerco River, Crazy Creek, Wide Ruin Wash, Mesa Wash, Billy Wash, Tanner Wash, Manila Wash, West Twin Wash, Little Lithodendron Wash, Coyote Wash, Lithodendron Wash, Pueblo Colorado Wash, Leroux Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
